thread.title: State players go into NFL's Week 5 as league leaders, with TV and odds
thread.title_full: State players go into NFL's Week 5 as league leaders, with TV and odds | AL.com

author: Mark Inabinett | minabinett@al.com
title: State players go into NFL's Week 5 as league leaders, with TV and odds
text:
One-quarter of the way through the 2015 NFL season, players with Alabama football roots lead four major statistical categories.
San Diego Chargers quarterback Philip Rivers tops the NFL in passing yards with 1,249. Rivers prepped at Athens High School.
Atlanta Falcons wide receiver Julio Jones leads the NFL with 38 receptions and is tied with Antonio Brown of the Pittsburgh Steelers for the most receiving yards at 478. Jones played at Foley High School before going on to Alabama .
Denver Broncos outside linebacker DeMarcus Ware has the most sacks in the NFL with 4.5. Ware prepped at Auburn High School before playing collegiately at Troy .
Hard to beat people who never give up. #ThankfulThursday #Broncos pic.twitter.com/L8GWqIKsPK
â€” D-Ware (@DeMarcusWare) October 8, 2015 Jones and Ware also play on teams that have won all four of their games this season. Rivers' Chargers are 2-2 after an injury-filled first four games. San Diego defeated the Cleveland Browns 30-27 on Sunday even though three of its five regulars on the offensive line were out. On Wednesday, neither guard D.J. Fluker from Alabama or tackle King Dunlap from Auburn practiced. Dunlap missed Sunday's game because of a concussion. Fluker, who missed the third game of the season, played on Sunday despite an ankle injury.
The Chargers will play in one of Week 5's nationally televised games when San Diego hosts Pittsburgh on Monday night. ESPN will televise the game at 7:30 CDT.
The Indianapolis Colts visit the Houston Texans on Thursday night to kick off Week 5. CBS and NFL Network will televise the game at 7:25.
In the Sunday night game on NBC, the San Francisco 49ers visit the New York Giants at 7:30.
The game of the week for the state of Alabama kicks off at noon Sunday when the St. Louis Rams visit the Green Bay Packers. The teams have 12 players from Alabama high schools and colleges on their rosters.
The St. Louis-Green Bay game will be the main broadcast offering in Alabama as the early game of CBS' Sunday doubleheader. Viewers along the northern edge of the state can see the Buffalo Bills-Tennessee Titans game and those in the southeast corner will be able to see the Jacksonville Jaguars-Tampa Bay Buccaneers game as the CBS' noon broadcast.
CHECK OUT MAPS OF SUNDAY'S BROADCAST TV COVERAGE
At 3:25 p.m. Sunday, Alabama's CBS affiliates will broadcast the New England Patriots-Dallas Cowboys game.
The FOX single game at noon Sunday will split the state's broadcasters between the Falcons' game against the Washington Redskins and the New Orleans Saints-Philadelphia Eagles game.
FOR MORE OF AL.COM'S COMPREHENSIVE COVERAGE OF THE NFL, GO TO OUR NFL PAGE
The complete Week 5 schedule (with all times in Central Daylight and with point spreads from vegasinsider.com ):
THURSDAY
Indianapolis Colts at Houston Texans (-2.5), 7:25 p.m. (CBS, NFL Network)
SUNDAY
Washington Redskins at Atlanta Falcons (-7.5), noon
Cleveland Browns at Baltimore Ravens (-6.5), noon
Seattle Seahawks at Cincinnati Bengals (-3), noon
St. Louis Rams at Green Bay Packers (-9), noon
Chicago Bears at Kansas City Chiefs (-9), noon
New Orleans Saints at Philadelphia Eagles (-4.5), noon
Jacksonville Jaguars at Tampa Bay Buccaneers (-3), noon
Buffalo Bills (-2.5) at Tennessee Titans, noon
Arizona Cardinals (-2.5) at Detroit Lions, 3:05 p.m.
New England Patriots (-8.5) at Dallas Cowboys, 3:25 p.m.
Denver Broncos (-4.5) at Oakland Raiders, 3:25 p.m.
San Francisco 49ers at New York Giants (-7), 7:30 p.m. (NBC)
MONDAY
Pittsburgh Steelers at San Diego Chargers (-3), 7:30 p.m. (ESPN)
